user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_fs_desuperblock:
```c
static int lfs_fs_desuperblock(lfs_t *lfs) {
    if (!lfs_gstate_needssuperblock(&lfs->gstate)) {
        return 0;
    }

    LFS_DEBUG("Rewriting superblock {0x%"PRIx32", 0x%"PRIx32"}",
            lfs->root[0],
            lfs->root[1]);

    lfs_mdir_t root;
    int err = lfs_dir_fetch(lfs, &root, lfs->root);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }

    // write a new superblock
    lfs_superblock_t superblock = {
        .version     = lfs_fs_disk_version(lfs),
        .block_size  = lfs->cfg->block_size,
        .block_count = lfs->block_count,
        .name_max    = lfs->name_max,
        .file_max    = lfs->file_max,
        .attr_max    = lfs->attr_max,
    };

    lfs_superblock_tole32(&superblock);
    err = lfs_dir_commit(lfs, &root, LFS_MKATTRS(
            {LFS_MKTAG(LFS_TYPE_INLINESTRUCT, 0, sizeof(superblock)),
                &superblock}));
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }

    lfs_fs_prepsuperblock(lfs, false);
    return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function lfs_fs_desuperblock:
#define LFS_MKATTRS(__VA_ARGS__) (structlfs_mattr[]){__VA_ARGS__},sizeof((structlfs_mattr[]){__VA_ARGS__})/sizeof(structlfs_mattr)
...
#define LFS_MKTAG(type, id, size) (((lfs_tag_t)(type)<<20)|((lfs_tag_t)(id)<<10)|(lfs_tag_t)(size))
...
#define LFS_DEBUG(__VA_ARGS__) LFS_DEBUG_(__VA_ARGS__,"")
...
typedef struct lfs_superblock {
    uint32_t version;
    lfs_size_t block_size;
    lfs_size_t block_count;
    lfs_size_t name_max;
    lfs_size_t file_max;
    lfs_size_t attr_max;
} lfs_superblock_t
...
typedef struct lfs {
    lfs_cache_t rcache;
    lfs_cache_t pcache;

    lfs_block_t root[2];
    struct lfs_mlist {
        struct lfs_mlist *next;
        uint16_t id;
        uint8_t type;
        lfs_mdir_t m;
    } *mlist;
    uint32_t seed;

    lfs_gstate_t gstate;
    lfs_gstate_t gdisk;
    lfs_gstate_t gdelta;

    struct lfs_lookahead {
        lfs_block_t start;
        lfs_block_t size;
        lfs_block_t next;
        lfs_block_t ckpoint;
        uint8_t *buffer;
    } lookahead;

    const struct lfs_config *cfg;
    lfs_size_t block_count;
    lfs_size_t name_max;
    lfs_size_t file_max;
    lfs_size_t attr_max;
    lfs_size_t inline_max;

#ifdef LFS_MIGRATE
    struct lfs1 *lfs1;
#endif
} lfs_t
...
typedef struct lfs_mdir {
    lfs_block_t pair[2];
    uint32_t rev;
    lfs_off_t off;
    uint32_t etag;
    uint16_t count;
    bool erased;
    bool split;
    lfs_block_t tail[2];
} lfs_mdir_t
...
static inline void lfs_superblock_tole32(lfs_superblock_t *superblock) {
    superblock->version     = lfs_tole32(superblock->version);
    superblock->block_size  = lfs_tole32(superblock->block_size);
    superblock->block_count = lfs_tole32(superblock->block_count);
    superblock->name_max    = lfs_tole32(superblock->name_max);
    superblock->file_max    = lfs_tole32(superblock->file_max);
    superblock->attr_max    = lfs_tole32(superblock->attr_max);
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I found no uses of compiler-specific language extensions that are explicitly documented as extensions (for example: GNU nested functions, typeof, statement-expressions ({ ... }), __attribute__, __asm__, __extension__ tokens, zero-length arrays, or other vendor-specific keywords). The constructs present are standard C features, not extensions: the function uses C99/C11 features such as // comments, designated initializers (.field = ...), compound literals ((type[]){ ... }) used inside the LFS_MKATTRS macro, variadic macros (__VA_ARGS__) used by LFS_DEBUG, static inline functions, and standard integer-format macros (PRIx32). The LFS_MKATTRS macro emits multiple comma-separated expressions to supply multiple function arguments via macro expansion — this is standard preprocessor behavior, not a compiler extension. Therefore there are no fragments that need to be investigated for Rule 1.2 in the provided code.
